entries.title: Player Interview: Darren
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"I played my first D&D game at highschool. It was a boring game where there were so many players and so little time that I could barely get to do anything, but it was still alright."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I've mostly only done D&D 5e, before we got into savage worlds. At highschool and mostly on Roll20."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Most of the fun that I get comes when I overcome some huge challenge, like with Lykel. When he was wrestling and battling the Fomorian, and battling with the dwarven soldiers."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"A game where I don't get to do anything. Or where everything I do results in failure."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"In real life I mostly enjoyed making jokes about how I seduced a goblin as we were both falling to our deaths.Or interrogated a rock which I believed to be a gnome, while proclaiming myself as batman."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"I've played Lykel and Cecil."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I play Darkest Dungeon, Blazblue, Fire Emblem, and a little bit of Skyrim. Mainly Fire Emblem."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"I suppose that I most enjoy acting upon some heroic quality. But I don't have many ideas aside from that. Aside from maybe risk-taking. Creating conflict amongst the party."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book of all times?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Hm. I suppose that the first few Eragon books were great."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: StrangeSpeeder
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"],["em"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"About a year or two ago. Other than that, having fun RPing."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"The most unfun thing that HAS happened imo, are 'cutscenes'. I guess the time my party got betrayed in a dessert and had to fight off an aspect of tiamat and our rival party at the same time is one. So was another series by the same author who's name escapes me."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Ratt
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"When I was 9 my babysitter walked us through a modern adventure, there werent stats dice or maps but it was still a ttrpg"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Good ones, I like them buy and large"]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The exploration of a consistent universe. Things follow rules, and no two opposite things can happen at once (like a piece of wood simultaneously being on fire and impossible to set on fire), and roleplaying with a team that gets along"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"A session where there was clearly something that the DM wanted to accomplish and they threw out rules, of both the game and of the in universe logic, to achieve it, in order to do something to the players, or where they let the players do anything throwing out the rules"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"From a private session with my family, when I was 10 I was the DM for totally free form diceless games my cousins would play at Thanksgiving, and it became a running gag that whenever I was bored I would either kill someone via bus or make someone find a cat that also was a god, the moment I still remember years later is when only one character was left, they walked out of their apartment building with a new robot arm, they we're getting evicted, feeling sad, when I hit them with a bus, instant death. I was hungry, and the adults were serving some kind of dessert. From an Ashenland game, the most recent campaign has been by far the best, and Alexis and Pines response to Als death was by far the best"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Kosh the fire cultist, Dober the Doglin Warlord and Pines the goblin sniper."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Lots, video games, board games and rpgs. I'm particularly fond of TF2, Portal, Munchkin and Legend"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Character creation from both the DMs and the Players side. There is world building character building and rules all in one"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Worm, I was emotionally invested through 7000 pages, that takes a lot"]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Merpac

entries.title: Player Interview: Wesley
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Around my junior year in high school"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"On and off for about 15 years with 2 games that lasted more than a year each, the longest being about 3 years. As well as a DM in a couple of games, the longest lasting about 6 months."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I get the most fun from telling a story through RP"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Being obviously railroaded into or out of a situation."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I had a Kitsune Wild Sorcerer in a 3.5 game that was going for about 8 months at the time who was in love with an NPC that acted as a teacher and a father figure to her. In this one session however that NPC had been found out to be working against the party toward some opposing goal. Being torn between her love for the NPC and her loyalty to the party the session turned into a very well performed drama between the party trying to convince her to leave the NPC and help them against him. Just as they thought they had her convinced she had managed to lure them into a trap for her love. The party had to fight both the NPC and her and they managed to defeat the NPC but he ran off and they subdued her. By the end of the session they had her convinced the NPC had her under some kind of spell that made her love him and she agreed with them, but knew that was not the truth because she had loved him for years before she had met the rest of the party."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Lael"]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"D&D(or other TTRPG), Warhammer 40k, Skyrim, Sims 4, Rimworld, and then just about any multiplayer game that a majority of my friends are playing at the time or any single player game that comes out that I feel like playing but those are the games I keep going back to all the time. My Steam library alone has around 300 games in it."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The one thing I like above all other things about TTRPGs is that there is no set way to handle anything. So you can do anything in an attempt to do what you are trying to do without it having to be preprogramed. Want to kill everything, go for it. Want to never have a single combat and solve everything by talking your way out of it or using politics to take care of everything , go for it."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"That is a hard question. I have 'read' more books in the last 2 years than I have in the rest of my life. If you asked me this question about 3 years ago I likely would say The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, but now? I have to give a top 5 in no order as I cant pick just one between these, Red Shirts by John Scalzi, the NPCs series by Drew Hayes, Off to Be the Wizard series by Scott Meyer, Hell Divers series by Nicholas Sansbury Smith, and Critical Failures series by Robert Bevan. I know this is not really a good answer to the question but I have been reading just so many good stories that are all still fresh enough in my mind that none of them stand out above the rest for me."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Nope

Joined a D&D session, in Tabletop Simulator, and played a 5e one-shot as a warlock. After that I played another 3 short sessions, when that ended I looked to play more D&D sessions, which was when I started using roll20 and played the first campaign in this group. Technically that was the first actual campaign I played."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Aside from what is above, I haven't played much other than D&D. If actual plot, I really enjoyed the whole conflict at Alisont, with Kosh Zig being an antagonist. Although, in that campaign, many NPCs had the power to render the spellcasters useless in seconds, which falls under 4. Memorable anyway."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Yu'karin, Nithnirith, Eahthryd, X'arith, Rose and Augusta."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"That I remember I play the more recent xcom games, Albion online, H3VR, Kerbal Space Program, Dota 2, Divinity: Original Sin 2, Planetside 2, Borderlands 2 and Tower Unite. "]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The idea that those fights mentioned on 3 can happen, although i do prefer to work up to it and then be presented to that type of situation, that appeals to me the most."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I haven't read any books lately."]]]]]}

entries.title: Kemono Islands
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["image",{"src":"https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/ashenlandlore/images/c/c3/Kemono_Archipelago.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/310?cb=20180630195142","alt":"","title":"","caption":"The 3 main islands","cardWidth":""}]],"markups":[["em"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Kemono Islands are an archipelago located northeast of Ashenland, largely obscure to Ashenland because of it's way of life."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Overview"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Kemono islands are in large part a monarchy made up of 9 different families, each attributing their nature to a different family of animals. Of the three islands, each is dominated by one of the race's three subspecies- Terrestrial, Aquatic, and Aerial. Three families rule over each island, and each family is led by a wisened and learned priestess which represents the rest of their family."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The 9 families keep knowledge of the arcane strictly obscure- Most common people don't even know that it exists, outside of what the nobles of the land show them."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The only ones with access to it are the 9 families and their branches of noblemen and nobleladies, supposedly by divine providence. The common people have advanced themselves technologically to make up for this lack of arcane power. Strict information control and harsh laws help to keep everything and everyone in these islands in order."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Geography"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Kemono archipelago has 3 main islands, being them named Seijitsu, Zhuānyè, and Jumun, they're considered the provinces of this country. Besides several small islands who count as small cities."]]],[10,0],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Zhuānyè"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Zhuānyè means discipline. It is the main island, the biggest of them, the majority of the population is made of terrestrial kemonos, although many avian and aquatic kemonos can also be seen there. Zhuānyè has most of the population and it has a strong impact in the economic power of the entire country. Most of the goods consumed by the entirety of the population are made in here. Its main city is Dōngjīng, where the three palaces show where the priestess live. Each has its own set of temples, towers, residences, galleries, courtyards, gardens, and outbuildings. In the middle of the city, there is the highest of the temples, dedicated total and entirely to Inna, the goddess of moon and law. The priestesses in charge of this island are Jing Huang, Syaoran Mei, and Yuting Sui."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Seijitsu"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Seijutsu means law. It's the second biggest island, and the most technologically advanced one, the majority of the population is of aquatic kemonos, followed by their avian counterparts. Most new advents come from here, there's a noble order of artificers widely known, any nobleman from any island can become a part of the order if shown enough talent and determination. Magic is a bigger taboo in this island than any other, most public performances of arcane mastery are said to be technological tricks. The main city here is Tsuki, where the 3 main castles (Shiro) stay, they're home to the families of three main priestesses, being them named: Amane Rigo, Pak Hae-Ju, and Shakaku Rise."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Jumun"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[0],1,"Ju"],[0,[],0,"mun means order. It's the smallest of them all but it's still considered big. Jumun is the cultural and military center, which is why it's commonly the main place for the new year festivals, although each island makes their own festival. The capital is known as Seon-Yul and it has the largest and most intricately built of all the temples. They're artists and most of the magic users tend to prefer illusions and conjurations. The three palaces belong to Lee Dal-Nim, Mihiro Chidori, and Mo Daiyu."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Priestesses and Noble Families"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Status and social class plays an important role in how is your life in the Kemono islands. The priestess families are known and are rather antique, some of them dating back to the beginning of the country when only the Zhuānyè island was actually populated. Just like everything else related to religion, everything results in 9. It's not too common to see the priestess walking in the streets but sometimes they appear. Usually, if they're appearing to the public, they're in their dark blue, ceremonial clothing. The 9 priestess and their families will be listed here, in order of economic and political power."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Golden Rooster"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Jing family is the oldest and most powerful of all priestesses' families. Their priestess now is Huang, a young adult, about 150 years old. Huang is kind and altruistic and is a wonderful healer, often going around in the cities nearby and helping citizens. Even being good she still suffers a little prejudice for being an aerial kemono in a terrestrial kemono island. She's married and has one son."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Red Fox"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Shakaku family is a family of many branches, some of them lost their name like the Sasahi and the Akane families, they're considered lesser nobles. Surprisingly, the woman chosen for the priesthood was Rise, an egoistic and harsh woman of undeniable beauty. She rules with an iron fist and is often arguing with Hae-Ju about what should be done. She seems to be good friends with Rigo and they tend to help each other to convince or overcome Hae-Ju's opinion. She's about 275 years old, and although she has a daughter and two nieces none is being trained for priestery."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Dumbo Octopus"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Lee family is almost as old as the Jing family, it rose up when the Jumun island was being populated. Dal-Nim, their priestess, is the main priestess in this island and is as amicable as can be. She has one daughter (Min, 11 years old) and is a widow. She teaches her daughter to be a priestess as compassionate as she is. You can often find her in the temple with her daughter. She says she won't marry again."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Gray Wolf"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Syaoran is a family of mostly men, it seems that each generation has 3 times as much males than females. Once every 3-5 generations, they choose one of the toddler girls to be the next priestess and that is the one who's trained. The priestesses from the Syaoran family usually devote their entire lives to the priesthood, another priestess only rises when the previous one dies. Their priestess now is the young Mei, 68 years old. Although her family has status, she's still considered a priestess in training for the other priestess due to her age and inexperience."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Violet Crow"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Mihiro family is known for their cleverness, they are the strategical part of the army, a fundamental role. They're one of the two families that choose priestesses based on their potential rather than birthrights, for this they have a slightly bad reputation. Chidori, 213 years-old, is the one in charge, for now, her companionability and intelligence are remarkable, being extremely precise in her calculations and quick to think she's the one in charge of the majority of the army. She was never married and she has the help of the son of her older brother and the two sons of her cousin to command the army, all of them are paladins and generals. They say she's a very demanding and perfectionist leader, having soldier train until reaching perfection. The Mihiro family also is the owner of the homonym school of archery."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Masked Owl"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Mo family, just like the Mihiro family, is known for being smart, they're the ones responsible for the order of artificers, the Tekisa. They're the second family who has a kind of test for small girls become possible priestesses. Daiyu, 252 years-old, is known for her persuasion and determination. Learning quickly and being an avid reader she seems to enjoy spending time in the artificer order more than in any temple. She's always seeking technological advances in warfare and visits Chidori often, she makes the weapons and Chidori finds out the best way of using them. She's a single daughter and is married to Katsuo, Chidori's older brother, which makes people wonder if when her daughter becomes the next priestess will she be considered a Mo or a Mihiro."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Blue Dragon"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also known as The Blue Sea Slug, Pak is a small and not so popular family but, nonetheless, it's a priestess' family. They, like most other families, wait for Inna to bless a given child to train her for the priesthood. Hae-Ju is a young woman, have just completed her 188th birthday. She's cheerful and calm and seems to be the most devoted of all priestesses. She's often seen in the temple and has two sons, Yoosung (25) and Jumin(17), she has about 30 years of priestery and it the most inexperient one, being treated like Syaoran due to this. Both her children are part of the Tekisa."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Bloody Jelly"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Amane family is an old and traditional family, even if not holding that much power in itself. Their priestess is Rigo (324), a blind sorceress who's focused on divination magic, she's known for using magic blindsense at all times. The Amane family seems to be tied to almost every important family, and is one of the few families that always get politically advantageous marriages for the new generations when they're still super young, they seem to think that a child is much more adult than they look like and more often than not starts training their kids pretty early, around age 8. Rigo has two male sons and is married to a second branch Syaoran, her oldest granddaughter, Aino (19), is the one being trained for priestery."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Cashmere Lop"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Yuting is another small and unpopular family, they have a couple of farms but nothing to be acknowledged for. Their priestess, Sui (267), is a small and shy woman from the secondary branch, all her cousins and siblings are male. She's usually always fretting around trying to keep Huang and Mei from fighting each other, she's very kind and altruistic. She is not married, and says she has no intention of doing so, therefore the next priestess might be her niece."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"The Revolution"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Rebellion is a movement to oust the 9 families from power and give freedom to the people. Their end goal is to spread knowledge of the secrets that said families have been hiding, and to expose the corruption that supposedly exists within those same families. The rebellion has been secretly supported by the Sasahi family, and is championed by a hero that leads them through the battle against the priestesses. The heroes position is passed down whenever the previous hero falls, along with his title."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Followers of the rebellion prefer to follow Inna's sister Katrina, the goddess of storms, the sea, and chaos."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"By Laura"]]]]}

entries.title: Ketu
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A half destroyed city near the coast. Has the biggest fighting arena existent, which brings lots of people to the town, problems with pirates make it a dangerous city but yet it’s seen as a beautiful city and visited by lots of people, specially due to beaches, fights and good drinks. Controlled by 3 pirate mafias this city constantly has legal problems due to its inside political fight. The main language spoken here is common but you can often hear people speaking aquan due to many merpeople and standing merfolk. Their economy spins around tourism and food is generally expensive here because there’s no place to farm, seafood is highly consumed (and it’s quite cheaper) and they make the best rum in all Ashenland. The arena, named Kar Thalay, is the most important part of Ketu, located right in the middle of the city between the two main districts, Kidkan and Ngein, its half destroyed aspect is kept for aesthetic purposes but inside it has been rebuilt in order to accommodate more people with more comfort."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"The Pirates"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There are 3 pirate crews controlling Ketu, none of them are liked by merpeople so it's common to see fights between pirates and merpeople."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Sea Angels"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"They are a crew made of generally pretty individuals, their 6 ships are the most threating for merfolk and this is also the greatest of crews. They're kind of neutral towards most laws but tend to do as they please. They're more famous for \"controlling\" brothels and all the slavery."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Their leader is Violette, an uncaring, provocative and elegant tiefling who's very skilled in bare-hand fighting and rarely spills blood, preferring to kill opponents with internal haemorrhages. Her devilish nature doesn't make her any less scared of flames, as she has a childhood trauma, and so she usually uses magic light wherever she needs."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Neptune Bandits"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This is a crew of urchins, poorer than the Angels so they have fewer ships but a crew just as big. they focus mostly on looting and are the greatest of problems for every ship, although they were seen ignoring deliberately the WW and this lead to a series of humours on whether the two leaders had a deal or a relationship of some sort."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Aggy, as she prefers to be called, was abandoned as a child and joined the Bandits for their treasure hunt, she was so utterly excited in the idea of finding such treasure that she got the map tattooed in herself. Being determined, she quickly climbed up the hierarchy. She's hot headed and imprudent but stubborn enough not to give up, she's willing to travel every sea to find that treasure and this inspiring behaviour conquered several men and women who were miserable. She constantly uses her innate magical powers to aid her melee combat and more often than not sets fire to other ships' sails before raiding them. When not on sea she can be found with her crew mates in one of the many pubs of the town, they kind of rule those."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"The Water Walkers"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Diplomatic and good-aligned pirates are a rare find, but aren't inexistent. The WW are opposing forces to both the Angels and the Bandits, they're way smaller than the other crews and are constantly shun at but still they managed to control a great part of the city since the last captain took the lead. They often raid and take down slave and other pirate ships, almost as a police force."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Mykros, the elf-like water genasi, is very diplomatic and patient, which means many deals were made, but he does tend to be deceitful, tricking pirates into deals that basically makes them forcefully stop pirating even if they don't immediately notice it. He's constantly with his first-mate, a calm and quiet fire genasi who worked really hard to be accepted as a pirate, and whenever he's given something written he mindlessly gives it so she can read out loud, which makes people think he's a snob. Although all places are protected by them, they tend to stick to people's homes, shops, inns, and anything that's not being controlled by the Bandits or the Angels."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"By Laura"]]]]}

entries.title: The System
entries.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"*Examples:* * *Arwena* * *John Smith* * *Mr. Blake* * *Ugly* * *Nameless One* * *L*"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"*Examples:* * *Ever-hooded edgy hacker* * *Green-skinned, grumpy ogre* * *Small girl wanting to save the world* * *Brave, light-haired paladin* * *Mysterious, stealthy agent* * *Lumberjack seeking vengeance*"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"### Descriptors The phrases you can describe your character with. The fewer They're divided to four categories, on default you start with one in each type. While choosing them, keep your character concept in mind. #### Body Innate trait of physical manifestation, can't be lost without a great effort *Examples:* * *Slightly Overweight* * *Tall* * *Slim* * *Muscled* * *Agile* * *Cat-eared* #### Mind Innate trait of personality or mental capabilities, you can't simply get rid of it *Examples:* * *Clever* * *Persuasive* * *Slow-minded* * *Easily Deconcentrating* * *Strategic* * *Honest* #### Edge Acquired skill, an activity your character is good at. May come from occupation. *Examples:* * *Lawyer* * *Gambler* * *Cook* * *Linguist* * *Sorcerer* * *Dancer* #### Flaw The trait your character is infamous for. Should bring a clear disadvantage. *Examples:* * *Uncharismatic* * *Bad-luck Brian* * *Greedy* * *Jerk* * *Adrenaline Addict* * *Liar*"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"*Examples:* * *Hobbled* * *Poisoned* * *Flying* * *Wounded* * *Prone* * *Drunk*"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"*Examples:* * *Sturdy Meat Clever* * *Thin Rope* * *Trusty Dog* * *Noisy Machine Gun* * *Capacious Bag of Crayons* * *Comfortable Car*"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"*Example:* *Tennessee Smith is a mild-mannered professor of history, but in his spare time he travels into the wilderness in search of lost artifacts and treasure. Ruggedly handsome, he always seems to keep his cool, no matter how much danger he is in—and he tends to get into a lot of it!*"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"### Drives Your character's motivation, ambition, task or quest he or she has to complete. #### What do you want? Describe, what is the ultimate goal of your character. *Example:* *Tennessee Smith is in search of the Idol of Tot, an artifact he has coveted for decades.* #### What is stopping you? Describe, what events or circumstances make it difficult to achieve. *Example:* *His rival, Giles Fishburne is also after the idol and always seems to be one step ahead.* #### What will you do? Describe, what actions your character will take to reach the goal. *Example:* *Tennessee is desperate to succeed this time and will do almost anything to get the idol - though he would never kill for it.* "}],["markdown",{"markdown":"*Example:* *Dave writes; Tennessee Smith and Lumina met at Harvard where Lumina was giving a presentation on the ancient cultures of Jupiter. Nina is happy with this, adding only that both characters were attracted to each other but Lumina is too focussed on her mission to have any romantic dalliance.*"}],["html",{"html":"
Roll Result
6 Yes, and... You get what you want, and something else.
5 Yes... You get what you want.
4 Yes, but... You get what you want, but at a cost.
3 No, but... You don’t get what you want, but it’s not a total loss.
2 No... You don’t get what you were after.
1 No, and... You don’t get what you want, and things get worse.
"}]],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Lightweight, no-brainer roleplaying system based on Freeform Universal, which operates d6 (6-sided die). Since it's the most common die, you can play it in almost any place with access to basic entertainment (on boring party, in the train, even in prison!). For when there's no dice, there's also a coin flip variant."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Character sheet"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A simple character sheet, which can be used for both characters played by players, and the Narrator himself."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Name"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Pick a catchy name for your character. Does he/she have a surname? A nickname? Maybe forgot his/her name?"]]],[10,0],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Concept"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to describe core idea for your character in few words. How can others describe your character, not knowing his/her name? How should your character be roleplayed? Here you can include character's race, appearance, behavior, occupation, background... It adds flavor to the game and makes explaining your character way easier."]]],[10,1],[10,2],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Conditions"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"These are more or less temporary statuses, which your character may acquire during adventure. You don't define them during character creation, but later on may affect your character's performance."]]],[10,3],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Gear"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Apart from clothes matching your character's background, you can pick two interesting and/or useful items. They don't have to be one-part items (you can treat quiver with arrows or trilogy of books bound with a string as one item). Every item needs a descriptor, as well - it makes items unique and sometimes changes the odds of actions performed with them. On top of chosen items, you get set of clothes. Dignity should be free."]]],[10,4],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Description"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In other words, biography. Describe backstory of your character. What happened before he/she became an adventurer? You can also add some short descriptions of places, events, people, organizations or objects your character knows about, and which shaped his/her past."]]],[10,5],[10,6],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Relationships"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Beings your character is familiar with. Does your character have friends? How about foes? It's the high time to describe them all. Treat it as if you were to define character Concepts for each of them - few words of description, type of relationship and circumstances in which this relationship was created. Who knows, perhaps some of them will appear during the story, roleplayed by Narrator."]]],[10,7],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Gameplay"]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Scene Description"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Narrator describes the scenery, in which the action takes place. He/she may describe things player characters experience with their senses (sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch), attaching couple of descriptors to elements of the scene (just like characters or gear can have descriptors). Narrator may describe side characters or pieces of gear which occupy the place."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Character's Action"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After scene's description is presented, the rest of the players may describe their characters' interactions with presented world, in turns. If the interaction seems to be nontrivial, they're advised to include their characters' descriptors, gear, scene elements or gained conditions which give them advantages."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Action's Resolution"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It's when Narrator decides, how many of such factors apply to a given type of interaction, possibly adding unexpected factors. After summing up the bonuses (positives) and penalties (negatives) from all the factors, player rolls number of d6 dice equal to 1+bonus and takes highest roll for result. In case if there's more penalties than bonuses, player rolls 1+penalty and takes lowest roll for result. If there's as much bonuses as penalties, player rolls single d6 die. The outcome depends on number, which was scored as a result:"]]],[10,8],[1,"p",[]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Mire
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"I’ve never played in person- All of my games have been online using Roll20. Though I have been playing for about 5 Years. That said- I wouldn’t mind in-person games. But I find more variety online!"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"My first campaign was a Savage World’s rendtition of Elder Scroll’s Skyrim. Since then I have played several games and systems; Savage Worlds, D&D 5e, WOIN, Pathfinder, Base D20, FATE, Shadowrun, Vampyr The Masquerade, Naruto D20, Zelda D20, and a Star Wars System."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Freedom of Choice. I like being able to do anything and everything- Much like a true Open World RPG. That said I also love intricate and story if there is nothing but combat everything tends to grow stale."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Out of Character Arguing. It tends to halt and slow everything. Breaking the illusion."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"That’s tough- Not because everything is boring but, rather, there have been so many memorable moments. In particular, to Ashenland, it would have to be when the Party abandoned my character to die after he stopped a ghost and helped stave off demons. Still sore about that- But what goes around comes around!"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Asher, Amon, and Azuris. Hmm- I’m seeing a theme for Casters with A Names."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"RPGs, Open Worlds, and Excellent Story Games. With the occasional Shooters. I like creativity, opportunity, and meaning- With a bit of action tossed in."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Freedom of Choice. After that, making new friends and bonding over a shared tale."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Inheritance Cycle, Night Angel Trilogy, Kingkiller Chronicles."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: WolfHeart
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Although i knew about d&d since around 2012, my first actual experience was in i think 2014 when i was at some daytime summer camp thing and a group of kids were playing, i sat with them and watched every day until one day one of the players didnt show up and they offered me to play in their place"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Very little, i can never find anyone to play these kind of things with me, this is the first true group i had"]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The roleplaying, ive heen roleplaying since like the age of 5 and never grew out of it, i had a couple larp? groups with kids in the neighborhood, both groups lasted several years in the same world/story, its since become a necessity for me and a coping mechanism"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"One player becoming very overpowered and it becoming a one player game because they do everything"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I dont really have any stories... but my character always had those shrooms"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Duflin Bundar, thats it, thats my only character, i really need to start playing again."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I am a very heavy roleplayer, i do so with a group of friends over a discord server svery waking moment that i have"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Becoming the character, like not existing as the player anymore, but as the character"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I dunno, ill just list some that i really like: the warrior cats series, war of the worlds, the hobbit, a monster calls, i cant think of them right now"]]]]]}

entries.title: Arbor
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A village to on tropical island Raznth inhabited by a community of dragonborn ruled over by the Arbor family. There are rumours of a male dragon nicked the ‘Wise Green’, who serves as a local patron. True dragon's name is Melchior and he wasn't seen since the Great Event. Most of the village is hidden among the trees and in ancient ruins around it. Dragonborn military is commanded here by four generals, called Qīnglóng, Zhūquè, Báihǔ and Xuánwǔ."]]]]}

entries.title: Mirfield
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A little, troubled town in the middle of the continent. It serves as colony of the human capital Alisont. Multiple types of cultures thrive and clash here. It is inhabited mostly by humans, and visited often by dwarves of Silvermount, who use it as a breakpoint on their trade route south, to Alisont. You can sometimes find here some elven guests from the adjacent Elysian Forest. Town is known from the Crowing Axe meadery, which meads are exported to the furthest parts of continent. There's also a dwarven blacksmith and general store ran by town's Mayor, Gregor Havicken, around year 336."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A river named Acsena flows across this place."]]]]}

entries.title: Alisont
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Rather big, emanating with life city.  The majority of inhabitants are of human kin, but the city is considered the most ethnically diverse in the whole Ashenland. Where are the humans, are usually dwarves and elves. Races here live in peace, cross breeding with each other. As a result - town is full of half-blooded humanoids. The town is supplied by farms placed on the north, beyond the strong, outer wall which protects the citizens."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The city was known, among other things, during the Great Event, town rulers used undead to defend from invaders."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"City consists of three major districts:"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Trade District - shops and guard’s barracks"]],[[0,[],0,"District of Wonders - asylum for social outcasts"]],[[0,[],0,"Temple District - temples and entrance to sewers"]],[[0,[],0,"Noble District - authority institutions, court"],[1,[],0,0]]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There’s also a river flowing through Noble and Temple districts, named Acsena."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"People here are of many cultures, but the most known gods here are Kousher and - due to dwarven contacts - Murn."]]]]}

entries.title: Elyse Allanar
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The home city to the elves of Ashenland. Elyse Allanar is called the everlasting grove. After the home tree of the forest was touched by Lady of Forests, the area grew trees that pulse and glow with pure life energy. An elven Druid named Adaris Nevaril spoke to Lady of Forests through the soul tree asking her with great desperation if he and his clan could live in the forest. Lady of Forests heard Adaris and the pleas of his clan allowing them sanctuary, Making magnificent homes for them from trees of iron and crystal. In return they had to make a vow to always protect the forest and and all costs never let anyone from outside his clan near the soul tree for if blood other than his or his kin. Where to touch the trees roots another spell plague would happen this time removing all natural magic from the Fey Wilds. Elysian elves together with Dragons and dragonborns from Raznth Island fought near Ketu before Great Event."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Inside the city there's a bunch of shops ran by local elves: general store, clothing store, blacksmith, arcane and potion shop, as well as an enchantment store for magic weapons and items."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In their free time, elves often spent their time in the Sleeping Unicorn Inn."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Later on, around year 337, Elyse was conquered by Koshites, who destroyed a big part of the forest in the Battle of the Burned Trees."]]]]}

entries.title: Elysian Forest
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A medium sized Fey Wild, one of the many Fey forests that have tremendous magical energies around it and where the space within the forest the magical energy is almost limitless."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Each Fey Wild is a sacred ground for the goddesses and primordials which dwell within its boundaries. This particular Fey Wild is one of the few groves touched with an Eternal Blessing from Lady of Forests, the sacred goddess of vitality, love, and nature. Many from Mirfield are cautious to go near the forest, claiming it to be fraught with danger. Rumors and tales speak of treants, unicorns, manticores, and other Fey creatures protecting the forest until an Arch Fey awakens from a Soul Seed to speak with the primordials of the wilds, and stop a plot to rekindle the primordial wars with the gods."]]]]}

entries.title: Silvermount
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Dwarven town which makes its income by mining the Silver Mountain’s foothills. It is highly industrialized - most of the dwarves here work with stone, metals and gems. As in typical dwarven society, xenophobia is a common phenomenon. Any race other than dwarf, gnome, halfling or human can feel discriminated here. They especially hate sharp-eared races, like orcs or elves. Many of Silvermount dwarves believe in Murn guidance."]]]]}

entries.title: Temple of Sacred Oil
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[["a",["href","https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v-Vwp3njTB_xQVpuhw9d3rRaW1tbIlSU17E5Yy_zZY0/edit#heading=h.sxteu3m72i1w"]]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Temple of Sacred Oil is a massive city wide cathedral for the Church of the Phoenix (see"],[0,[0],1," "],[0,[],0,"Kousher). The temple gets its name from the massive lake of oil inside, whether that lake was a natural gift from their god, or is imported, only the higher ups know. River named Acsena flows on western border of temple's region."]]]]}

entries.title: Face Fields
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Face Fields were a set of fields in which lay the faces of gods and titans, places of constant change and melancholy by their nature. It is said by some to be the work of the battles that previously took place within them that it is a place of constant chaos and uncontrolled change. It is unknown where their holes, which were formed during the battles between titans, lead. Most scholars agree that face fields are a place of constant change, and chaos- It is said that it acts as a gateway between different realms, as it’s ever shifting surface leaves only the most skilled of pathfinders to know where exactly they are trying to go. It is speculated that the faces themselves are in fact holes, and portals between different planes of existence. It is a world outside of space time, and plagued by constant sand storms and otherworldly beasts that have been driven mad by years of constant wars with little else to do, but fight. And through it all, they still smile."]]]]}

entries.title: Cave of Boll
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"A cave which leads to the underworld, wherein demons roam and the souls of those that associated with them lay in torment. It is said that some view the gods with pure hate, and view humans as mere tools for their disposal- To such ends they will force many into servitude after death, putting them into the bodies of feral tieflings and forcing them to live and die, over and over until their minds rot out of their skull, only to be replaced by another as the cycle begins anew. Afterwhich their spirit is unceremoniously devoured by hordes of rabid beasts. Not all tieflings are like this, but those that are provide enough reason in and of themselves to be cautious."]]]]}

entries.title: Scorched Fields
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Hunting grounds of a huge dragon. The ancient black dragon Eioglmir continuously mourns the two children of hers, whom she once found turned to stone, alongside her other missing (rumours say adoptive) child, who she has not seen since her other children died. The area is inhabited by gnomes and halflings, which hide from dragon in dirt mounds."]]]]}

entries.title: Town on Fire
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Town periodically burned down by aggressive black dragon called Ejoglmir, which hunting grounds are few miles to the east, as well as multiple red-cloaked wizards. It was said to be an orc village once. Now it serves as a hideout for various underdark outcasts coming from The Cave of Boll."]]]]}

entries.title: Lake of Alestria
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Huge lake in the middle of the Elysian Forest. It is occupied by multiple amphibian and reptile tribes, like bullywugs, lizardmen, tortles, and some dragonborn individuals."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Before year 837 the lake was split into three smaller lakes."]]]]}

entries.title: Silver Mountain
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The highest peak in the whole of Ashenland. It is said to be an extinguished volcano. It erupted around year 337, when avatar of Kousher woke up from its slumber."]]]]}

entries.title: Ashenland
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"* Wolfcrabs (or crabwolves) - giant, gray crabs hunting in packs on coasts around Raznth island\n* Mage's banes - magic-sensitive bugs"}]],"markups":[["em"],["s"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ashenland is a fictional place, where most of the story is being created."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Geography"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ashenland is a big, island-shaped continent with hundreds of miles in width and height. Northern parts are covered in snowy mountains, from which a river flows south, passing on the edge of dense woods and a desert."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Flora"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Mixed-type forests with one particular - called Elysian Forest. Includes many types of mushrooms, mostly underground - some of them living."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Fauna"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Various animals and magic beasts, with following being native:"]]],[10,0],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Origin and History"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"At the beginning of space and time a group of high-level beings emerged from the Void. They dreamed about creation of some lesser beings, because as we know - there are no true gods without worshippers."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"Conversely, other various forces and entities that exist after The Great Event existed during this time only as floating conceptualities, akin to dust and gas clouds in the void of pre-existence. These could be entities known after The Great Event as evil beings, such as rulers and/or applicable denizens of other planes considered lesser to the post-Great Event mortal realm."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"Gods had some conflict of interests, and they decided to settle it. The primordial wars a time when massive titans fought against one another for the sole reason of proving their might. These creatures were of such large size that just fragments of their elemental bodies were enough to create the world."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Of the first great beings, there were seven called Forefathers (though some of them are depicted as females) who led the other deities both in the decision to create mortals on the physical plane and in the war against the Primordials and Fiends during the Great Event. These seven are the greater gods, celestials with the most worshippers among mortals. It is unknown who the actual seventh god was, as there is no explicit mention of them in any mythology or historical texts from before the Great Event beyond some broken script saying 'Very'. So thanks to the rising influence of the cults of fire priests, this spot has recently been taken by Kousher."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Forefathers:"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Katrina"]],[[0,[],0,"Inna"]],[[0,[],0,"Murn"]],[[0,[],0,"Biblios"]],[[0,[],0,"Dragon God"]],[[0,[],0,"Lady of Forests"]],[[0,[],0,"Kousher"]],[[0,[1],1,"Verilean"]]]]]}

entries.title: Balros
entries.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"The highest level directly under Balros is populated with Exet leaders. There's 4 of them:
* Progress
* Alakune
* Peter
* Grin"}]],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also called the Lord of Greed. Demon who incites greed in mortals by rewarding them with magic trinkets and blessings for treasures they donate to him. He stores his wealth in demonic dimension with sea of blood and golden islands. When not busy with more important stuff, he likes to contemplate all the treasures he collected while sitting on his dread throne in Plane of Greed. Likes to call himself a “God”. Valuables resting in Balros' domain are known from being affected by spreading curse. One cursed item is capable of cursing adjacent ones, with greed-themed affliction. Because of it, fate of many thieves was sealed."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Cult of Greed"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Making use of demon's tendency to reward mortals for precious goods they offer to him, a group of his followers emerged, calling themselves Exet. Its members soon grew bored of collecting the goods manually, so they persuaded more people to do the work for them - of course for a partial share in Balros' rewards. More and more people became interested in the whole procedure - it's when Exet decided to split the responsibilities into financial structure resembling pyramid, becoming Exet Corporation. Soon, the organization grew into hundreds, if not thousands involved individuals, on various hierarchy levels, with higher levels (closer to Balros) being mostly administrative, and lower levels acting as stakeholders."]]],[10,0]]}

entries.title: Kousher
entries.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"Leaders in year 337:

Phoenix Dugo: 
Vermilion (II) Niao (III)

Red Hawks:
* Benu (III) Fenjor
* Kosh (II) Zig
* Anzu (IV) Grannir
* Boobrie (II) Lumrakas
* Garuda (I) Nogall
* Stymphalian (III) Lemwien
* Strige (II) Aly
* Liderc (V) Maric
* Cinnamologus (I) Jao
* Hoopoe (II) Elmorn"}]],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also known as God of Phoenixes, Kousher is the god of fire, retribution and phoenixes, his worshippers are primarily stationed in the northern half of Ashenland, and although he is a terrifying sight to behold, many worship him. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Once upon a time, he offered a powerful artifact to humanity, called The Face of Kousher."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"Church of the Phoenix"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Unlike many religions Kousher does not require sacrifices, just loyalty and self mutilation in the form of oil baths, known to cleanse people of sin, his followers are known for being powerful fire mages and powerful warriors."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The hierarchy of the church is as follows: There are your basic Phoean, who are just ordinary worshipers. Next are the Priests - these people run a very small worship section of the massive cathedral, next are the Deacons, they are assistants to the next group, the Mangangrals, who are supposed to keep the Priests in line while running a larger section of the cathedral. Next are the Red Hawks, they have the same responsibilities as a Mangangaral but there is far less of them as they also have the duty to elect the leader of the church, otherwise known as The Phoenix Dugo. The Phoenix Dugo and Red Hawks are spiritually connected to the Kousher himself and are capable of summoning his powers. The Phoenix Dugo can make any executive decision about the church they want. As per order of the current head of Church, members of the temple routinely go on assault runs to the underworld in order to halt the spread of the ideas created by Acedia, The Demonic Prince of Sloth."]]],[10,0]]}

entries.title: Character Creation Guide (D&D 5e)
entries.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["html",{"html":"

"}],["markdown",{"markdown":"Sample things that cause little to no imbalance: * Changing items to different items of the same total cost * Changing damage type to different damage type * Changing language to different language * Changing proficiency to different proficiency of the same type * Changing spell to a different spell of the same level * Changing racial trait to analogous trait from other race"}],["html",{"html":"
"}],["hr",{}]],"markups":[["strong"],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/races.html"]],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/classes.html"]],["a",["href","https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0Qx4NeOkTzTZ2lrT2JoeUxQclU/view"]],["a",["href","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bhtnbhfNfO4"]],["a",["href","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RH2fJYTG664"]],["a",["href","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ge3VLq9bv8k"]],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/backgrounds.html"]],["a",["href","https://5etools.com/items.html"]],["a",["href","https://ashenland.azurewebsites.net/gameplay-guide-dnd-5e"]]],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"1. Concept"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.1 Seven-word description"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to invent bunch of characters, which can be described in exactly 7 words. Think of character's most distinctive features. It's a quick method of researching possible options. Share them with other players and Dungeon Master in order to validate them and refine the best idea. They may suggest you some technical details. Example concepts:"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Curious human fighting with bow and sword"]],[[0,[],0,"Strong, but dumb half-orc with pet turtle"]],[[0,[],0,"Lich trying to find cure for undeath"]]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.2 Entertain yourself..."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Primarily, the character should bring you entertainment. If you're new to roleplaying, you might want to develop a character which matches your personality - during the game you will just need to be yourself. If you prefer to be someone else, try choosing a character which resembles some character from movie, video game or book."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.3 ... entertain other players"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Apart from being interesting to you, your character should provide visible and interesting ways of interaction with other players' characters."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"1.4 ... entertain DM"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Believe or not, DM wants to have some fun, too. Define some background, goals and problems which haunt your character, so that DM will be able to bind your character with the campaign's story."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"2. Sheet"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.1 Get the sheet"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you have no assigned sheet yet, you can grab free emergency sheet available in Journal tab. If there's no spare sheet, ask DM to create one for you."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Use game's Compendium ("i" tab on the right) to search for most of the things listed in the next steps (like items and spells) and drag&drop them to your character sheet. They will serve you as a reference for preparing good descriptions. For the world's lore reference, you can look at this blog's entries. You can also see a sample character in Journal tab."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to pick some climatic name for your character."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.2 Attributes"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You start on level 1. Roll your ability scores. You have 6 Ability scores to assign scores to (in any order): Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. You can either roll 4 6-sided die and record the cumulative total of the highest 3 dice 6 times (type #stats in chat to use macro for it) or take the “standard set” which is 15,14,13,12,10,8, or alternatively, make a point buy according to D&D rule. You do not need to assign these scores yet, but you can if you want to. If you think your rolls were weak, you can try to bargain with DM."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.3 Race"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Decide the race of your character. You can find all the available races "],[0,[1],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Each race has racial traits that affect your ability scores, skills checks, speed and/or proficiencies. This means that certain races are better suited for certain classes, but you can play as who you want. Write down the character’s race traits under the traits/features section of the character sheet."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.4 Class"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Now decide the class. You can find the classes "],[0,[2],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Each class will has a starting gear (which will be explained in 2.8), primary stat, hit die (which max value + your constitution bonus gives you your max hit points on level 1), saving throw proficiencies, armor and weapons proficiencies. You can find each of these on the class page. You will want to write these down on the bottom left of the character sheet. You will also want to look at the features your class has. Each class starts with features at level one and will gain access to more as they level up. Write down the character’s level one class features under the traits/features section of the character sheet. Also write down your overall proficiency bonus (if it wasn't previously automatically calculated by the sheet). If your class defines list of spells you can choose from, add the chosen ones in spells section. You can also pick spells converted from D&D 3.5e from "],[0,[3],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ensure all your traits/features/attacks/spells are properly described by clicking them in your sheet and observing chat output. Set each spell to show full description (instead of shortened one) - if you show reduced description during session, DM will ask you to show full anyway."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.5 Alignment"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Define your character's moral compass. This way DM can say, what sort of emotion will a given event induce in your character. Also, some magical artifacts require to be attuned to person of specific alignment. Here's a three-part guide to alignments: "],[0,[4],1,"Good"],[0,[],0,", "],[0,[5],1,"Neutral"],[0,[],0,", "],[0,[6],1,"Evil"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.6 Background"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Now you will want to decide on a background. Who was your character before now? The list of backgrounds is "],[0,[7],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Each background offers extra proficiencies and a feature, amongst other things. After choosing a background, you are supposed to roll dice to see which traits you acquire, but if you want you can pick them without rolling (or invent your own, providing it's 1-2 sentences long). The choice is yours. Write down the chosen personality, ideal, bond, flaw, proficiencies, features, languages, items and anything else your background provides you."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It's important to aggregate all weapon proficiencies into one, same with languages and tools - when DM asks players to show, for instance, language proficiencies, four players clicking every language separately will make quite a mess in the chat."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.7 Biography"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After you have your character's race, class and background, feel inspired to include some story fluff. What drives your character? Why did he/she start adventuring? Add at least short character biography to your sheet ("Character Sheet" -> "Bio" tab), in which you can define some people, monsters, lands, towns, characters and artifacts, which should appear in the world along with your own character. Because this description is accessible to other players, everything what appears here will be considered as something your character is willing to tell (or already told) about to his/her friends."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also think about a description in "Bio & Info" tab of your sheet - it's the only part of your sheet which can be seen by other players. Make sure it's concise - so that DM won't need to dig through pages of all the flavorful info to get to the core of your character's backstory (alternatively, you can put the most important parts in bold). It can be the same as your public biography in "Bio" tab, but perhaps your character has some secrets which can't go public?"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Define your character's sidequests as well. There should be two of them - can be separate, or bound together in a common goal. Describe them concisely somewhere in your private biography, so that DM can easily deduce on what condition your character should gain extra levels (one level per each sidequest)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.8 Items"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Next are weapons, armor and miscellaneous items. On your class page there's predetermined equipment that you can choose from (sometimes they are provided by Background, too). You can find all basic equipment "],[0,[8],1,"here"],[0,[],0,". Alternatively, instead of taking class items, you can buy any items you want, after rolling starting wealth from following table:"]]],[10,0],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After you have chosen your armor you will calculate your Armor Class. Your armor class is the armor rating + your dexterity bonus. Light armor allows full Dexterity Bonus, Medium armor only allows a +2 Dexterity Bonus, and Heavy armor allows no Dexterity Bonus. If you decide to go without the armor, your AC will be 10 + your dexterity bonus at default. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Remember to set item weights in the sheet - it will be used to determine encumbrance and overall character's weight."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.9 Attacks"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The last thing will be to add attacks your character can perform (if they weren't automatically added after you dragged&dropped weapons/spells to your sheet). Weapons refer to physical weapons such as a sword or bow. For these your attack bonus will be your strength modifier (melee) or dexterity modifier (ranged) + your proficiency bonus. Damage is what is listed on the weapon page + your Strength (or Dexterity, in case of Finesse weapons) modifier. Spell attacks are a bit more complex and you should rely on drag&drop method (otherwise, you need to set its damage and/or saving throws manually)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.10 Homebrew"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If the whole presented D&D content is still somehow not enough for you - you can try to design your own, custom elements. In order to make your creations mechanically balanced, try to find some existing reference from official source book - like spell, item, race, class (classes are especially difficult to balance, so if you don't want to waste hours or days of your and DM's life, stick to some smaller detail that makes you unique), and then adapting it. Use list below as homebrewing guideline."]]],[10,1],[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"3. Token"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you want a custom character token, you can find one by googling "rpg top down token" (must have transparent background!). You can also search by author's name - Devin Night usually makes quite good ones. Send token's link to DM. If you provide no token, DM will pick one for you."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Here's how the tokens should look like:"]]],[10,2],[10,3],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It seems your character is ready. You can now proceed to the "],[0,[9],1,"Gameplay Guide"],[0,[],0," to learn how to play efficiently."]]]]}

The Setup"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After you have prepared your character (using "],[0,[1],1,"Character Creation Guide"],[0,[],0,"), you can now proceed to prepare yourself for upcoming session."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],2,"1.1 Fill the "],[0,[],0,"Upcoming "],[0,[0,0],3,"Session Poll"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"It's a set of Discord messages which appear in #upcoming-sessions channel. Mark your times. There can be up to two sessions each weekend. Both of them need at least 3 core players who voted green and at most 5 players in total. Final squads will be reassigned, so that each player who voted should play at least one session. In case someone will need to be moved in order to create two balanced squads, there's a default priority (first by color, then by ascending number of voted days)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],3,"1.2 Download enhancement scripts"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[2],1,"betteR20"],[0,[],0," (requires "],[0,[3],1,"Tampermonkey"],[0,[],0," plugin)"]],[[0,[4],1,"VTT Enhancement Suite"],[0,[],0," (standalone browser plugin)"]]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"They enhance the overall gameplay, providing tons of functionalities useful for both players and DMs. Used mostly for dynamic lightning. Remember to restart your browser after you install them."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],3,"1.3 See more of the map"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Go to My Settings tab and set player avatar size to small. You will see more of the map."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0,0],3,"1.4 Switch to your role"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Switch your chat to your character. In most of the cases your player's nickname differs from your character's name, what makes speaking and acting as character a bit inconvenient from the perspective of other players. You can do it by picking your character name from the drop-down list under the chat."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0],2,"1.5 Ready your sheet"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Find your sheet in Journal tab."],[0,[0,0],2," "],[0,[],0,"After you found it, you can double click to minimize it. Give it a glance - if you see any missing feature/spell/attack - please fix it in the meantime, as soon as possible."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Also, make sure they all show effect's description (if such exists) upon click. Showing a spell with some rolled numbers, but without description of what the spell actually does forces DM to use Google or to ask you about the details - both ways take the time that could be otherwise used for roleplaying."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0,0],2,"1.6 Upgrade your rolls"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Set your character to Always Roll Advantage and Auto Roll Damage & Crit (there's a cog icon in your sheet). It will be enabled at default, and will make you roll twice (just in case you had advantage or disadvantage on that roll). This should speed the game up, since DM won't need to ask for extra rolls."]]],[1,"h3",[[0,[0],1,"2. The Roleplay"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Essentially, narrating your character's actions."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.1 In-character communication"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"After switching to your character's name, all words typed straight into the chat (without extra commands, nor parentheses) count as words spoken by your character, e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0,0],2,"Vrap Rennen:"],[0,[],0," Hey, do you like riddles?"]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.2 Out-of-character communication"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"To say something out-of-roleplay, you can switch to your player name or use round brackets or "],[0,[0],1,"/ooc <message>"],[0,[],0," command, e.g.:"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"Marcin Z.:"],[0,[],0," Thanks for the game!"]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[0],1,"Eahthryd:"],[0,[],0," (I didn't end my turn yet)"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Try to avoid playing out of your character, since it essentially replaces storytelling with boring technical explanations, and often ends with anticlimatic meta-game (you can read about it in 2.8)."]]],[1,"h4",[[0,[0],1,"2.3 Private communication"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"One of the best things in online sessions is possibility of conversing with DM without other players knowing about it.
